attributes.action: Provide funds for Hospices &Charities(Herriot Hospice- Hambleton&Richmondshire)
attributes.background: Herriot Hospice are ceasing to provide end of life care.Funding has been cut and the charity has had to subsidise up to 60%.It has been able to do this due to legacy, but this has been spent.It has decided to cease the service from 1/08/16 as it is not prepared to compromise on the service.
attributes.additional_details: My mother was diagnosed with cancer in 2014. Her wish was that she could stay at home to die. Herriot Hospice end of life care made this possible. These services must be allowed to operate with funding. My family are humbled by the services the devoted people provided and how they looked after her. Please help try to promote and share this petition.

attributes.action: To create a maximum working environment temperature.
attributes.background: Working in conditions that are too hot can become counter productive and can mean that staff cannot fully function and work to their best capacity.

attributes.action: make it  compulsory  to  neuter  after  1st litter  in dogs
attributes.background: please   help   these  rescue    reduce   being overun     by  making it  legal  all  owners  spay  after  first  litter
attributes.additional_details: we   the public  would  love  to  see a law    , that all  breeders   are  made  to  neuter  dogs  after  1st  litter  ,  and a law against  any breeder  cross breeding pedigree  dogs    ,  rescues  over  run  already and lots being  pts  as cant  be rehomed  , these   owners cross  breeding  for   cockapoo  etc  are adding  to  it

attributes.action: Cap Rent in the Private Sector
attributes.background: Each year rent increases by a substantial amount in the Private Rental sector, and people cannot cope with the fast growth on rental inflammation, as their salary does not always increase to maintain affordable housing.
attributes.additional_details: The Government needs to apply rent caps as to what landlords can charge to tenants in their properties; if people can save while they rent they may be able to start saving to put a realistic deposit down on a realistic priced house.

attributes.action: Bring back the Emerging Personality Disorder Unit in Somerset Areas
attributes.background:
The Emerging Personality Disorder team help many young adults who are diagnosed with Emerging Personality Disorders.
 A Personality Disorder is a type of mental illness that affects a persons behaviours and thoughts.
 The team in Somerset and surrounding areas has been cut.
attributes.additional_details: This team is key to many young adults recovery.

attributes.action: Change the house buying process in England, Wales and NI
attributes.background: A petition to address the requirement of consumer protection when purchasing or selling a property. Minimising financial exposure and risk after price agreement and the subsequent common terms of sale changes; gazumping, gazundering and pulling out. MPs to create safeguards in earlier commitment.

attributes.action: Have schools teach children the signs of domestic abuse, physical & emotional.
attributes.background: There are too many people who are being abused in their home and we need to make people including young children who may be victims of it aware of the signs so they can go for help if they need to. It will help reduce the amount of deaths each year which go unnoticed.
attributes.additional_details: There are many helpline such as Rising Sun but we need to make sure children and even adults are aware of this as well as aware of the tell tale signs that someone is a victim of abuse, or that they may be a victim.

attributes.action: Allow  my husband to live in the UK with his wife and daughter.
attributes.background: His spouse visa has been denied on the basis that 1 the financial side and 2 a place of residence upon arrival to the UK . Despite my mother writing a letter to confirm that me my husband and kids will be staying with her until we found a place of our own.
attributes.additional_details: we clearly mentioned in our appeal that life in the US wasn't good and I wanted to come home to the UK to be with my family and our daughter can grow up with her cousins something we don't have in the US.we arrived in the UK to spend time with the family our daughter goes to stay n play which she loves and is able to go to nursery for 15 hrs a week she's settled down perfectly my wife is staying in the UK to settle down get a house  our daughter and son can be with the family They are thriving.

attributes.action: Award of a National Defence Medal
attributes.background: I propose an award of a National Defence Medal to all serving and ex- serving members of HM Forces in recognition of the service that they have given/give to their country and to the people, subject to meeting certain criteria.
attributes.additional_details:
Not everyone was able to go into a war like zone but they nevertheless gave 100% effort.

Please recognise their efforts.

http://nationaldefencemedal.webs.com/Submission%20for%20the%20UK%20National%20Defence%20Medal.pdf

attributes.action: Abolish chancel repair liability
attributes.background: Chancel repair liability is an outdated burden created when Henry VIII destroyed monasteries and gave away their land, rarely mentioned in  deeds to property, but by which some property owners have been asked to pay the cost of repairing the chancel of the church relevant to their property.
attributes.additional_details:
Claims for payment are usually based on old maps of former church property.  Church and diocese records which might relate to this matter are often incomplete or non-existent or have been destroyed because no one realised that they might have some significance.

Lord Avebury's Bill to abolish chancel repair liability in the House of Lords fell due to lack of time in the parliamentary session before the general election in 2015.  The property of many people is subject to chancel repair notices.

attributes.action: Create a free fast-track citizenship programme for current resident EU citizens
attributes.background: This petition calls on Parliament to create a fast-track citizenship programme at no cost for all non-native EU citizens who wish to remain in the UK following our exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Do not invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty for five years
attributes.background: While acknowledging that Britain has voted by national referendum to leave the European Union, we the undersigned urge HM Government to withhold from invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty for a period of five years from the date of the referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This will provide the best framework for a well-managed British withdrawal from the European Union, promoting national unity, enabling fair and amicable negotiations, and preventing long term damage to the British economy.

attributes.action: Hold a UK referendum on the future of the union between Scotland and England.
attributes.background: Now the result of the EU referendum is known, the Scottish Government considers the prospect of a second Scottish independence referendum 'on the table'. A National referendum would allow for the will of the entire electorate to be known on the future of the Union formed in 1707.
attributes.additional_details: Some are calling, as in 2014, for the rest of the UK to have a voice in the question of Scottish independance. Many Scots, resident elsewhere in the UK or even Expats who were eligible to vote in the EU referendum, were not eligible for the 2014 independence referendum.

attributes.action: UK must reaffirm its commitment of sovereignty over Gibraltar after Brexit
attributes.background: With Spain renewing its claim of sovereignty over Gibraltar in a matter hours after the UK voted to leave the European Union, the UK Government must immediately reaffirm its commitment to Gibraltar .
attributes.additional_details:
The UK must a make a binding treaty with the European Union guaranteeing Gibraltar special status, which guarantees visa free cross-border movement for people and trade between Gibraltar and Spain. 

The UK government must grant Gibraltar their own dedicated MP in parliament 

The UK must re-establish our permanent Army and Royal Navy bases on Gibraltar to guarantee its future security.

attributes.action:
If the UK votes leave and London votes IN,
London should become Independent.
attributes.background: Polls suggest that London will vote in favour of remaining in the EU. Scotland is already planning to leave Great Britain in order to remain in the EU, if Britain votes to leave. London should have the opportunity to do the same. Its population is larger than many EU states.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/eu-referendum-london-backs-remain-vote-poll-shows-a3256001.html

attributes.action: Stop Government wrecking our Free BBC. Leave our BBC alone.
attributes.background: Government intend to draw up new proposals for a 'radical overhaul' in how the BBC is governed & audited. Currently the government hands over our licence fee monies in order to pay for our beloved BBC. In recent years there have been drastic cuts & reshaping but these new measures are very worrying.
attributes.additional_details: This is a totalitarian tactic damaging the impartiality of the BBC. The BBC is the only juggernaut working on behalf of the public with everyone's interests at heart. It's possible that if we allow government to rip the heart out of this organisation then, eventually, there will be very little truth being broadcast to the population. We cannot rely on the newspapers alone as they don't belong to us, & b) Many, including The Daily Mail & the Sun are owned by people such as Rupert Murdoch

attributes.action: Park Home residents should have the legal right to install water sub-meters.
attributes.background: All homes on our park pay an equal amount.  There are single and double occupied homes.  Many residents spend weeks or months away from their homes for different reasons, holidays, hospital stays etc.  Water leakage from the one meter on the park to the homes is included in the total bill.

attributes.action: Manditory detainment for persons arrested on suspicion of terrorism - no bail
attributes.background: In light of the current severe threat of terrorism in the UK and throughout the world, any individual arrested on suspicion of terrorist offences should be denied bail pending enquiries, charges and trial as they pose a genuine flight risk thus putting lives of the general public at greater risk.

attributes.action: Stop lobbying by means of political donation
attributes.background: It is about time that political lobbying is made both clearer and less open to abuse. Let's fund political parties out of public money only and end the opportunity for political lobbying via donations. Take lobbying by means of political donation out of the equation and there'd be a lot less sleaze.
attributes.additional_details: All political parties should be funded via a mechanism similar to short money which should be shared equally to all political parties that achieve a minimum number of members who agree to follow the Electoral Commission rules.

attributes.action: Stop or rethink the current pet passport system and bring back quarantine laws
attributes.background:
Following the recent case of babesiosis in Essex where two dogs have been destroyed I call for a review on the transportation and movement of domestic animal to and from our country.
I propose that quarantine restrictions are reinstated so that disease and illness is not missed in incubation period
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has previously been free of Babesiosis, Rabies and other disease and viruses found on the continent. Its my view it should stay this way especially due to our dense population and the risk of major outbreak is high. Take foot and mouth disease as an example of just how prolific the spread of disease can be and that only affected a controlled animal population.
We have put our borders in a situation that bring much avoidable risk and has allowed easy movement of puppies and stolen pets

attributes.action: Instruct Royal Mail to change its opt-out scheme for junk mail to an opt-in one.
attributes.background: Royal Mail earns over £1.3 bn each year from junk mail deliveries. (It calls it "unaddressed mail"). It offers an opt-out service, but this does not work. An opt-in system would ensure that only those who wish to receive junk mail receive it.
attributes.additional_details: The opt-out system does not work: there is no confirmation of a successful application to opt-out; the opt-out only lasts for two years; there is no notification of the end date; and there is no invitation to renew the opt-out at the end of the two year period. In spite of all the hurdles put in place by Royal Mail, junk mail still gets delivered. The system in place does not work, so it needs to be changed.

attributes.action: Permit a one off national holiday celebrating immigrants and their contributions
attributes.background: In light of recent doubts raised across multiple spectrums about the benefits of immigration we believe it is time for immigrants to reveal their true value the country. By staging a single one off strike/national holiday the impact of the U.K. without immigrants might be better understood.

attributes.action: Manchester & other pro-EU cities to become independent EU member city states
attributes.background:
Manchester, Liverpool, Leeds, London, etc... We didnt vote to leave the EU. We want to protections that EU membership offers in terms of workers rights, human rights, and environmental legislation. 
We want to secede from the UK & remain in the EU, operating as a network of independent city states.
attributes.additional_details:
The cities that voted to remain in the EU have a long history of welcoming migrants and of fighting for progressive values. We want to continue to enjoy the benefits of EU membership whilst also fighting for a better Europe. 

With devolution already on the agenda, our cities could operate as networked city-states with EU membership. We should hold local referenda on seceding from the UK and remaining in the EU.

attributes.action: Make legal Medical Cannabinoid Oil For personal use. Available to all patients
attributes.background: Documentated evidence  CB1 CB2 cannabinoids work  In regards to a test subject in Tenerife Certainly reporting positive feedback in regards to full relief from symptoms of Parkinson Disease
attributes.additional_details: Witness reports available from Kevin himself. His wife Susan. Myself the producer of the health oil.

attributes.action: Make conjugal visits legal in the UK
attributes.background: Conjucal visits in the uk could help inmates As there wouldn't be so much tension In the prison, it would relieve frustration which would make it a calmer environment. Also give the inmates something to work towards. Also partners on the outside suffer being away from there loved ones.

attributes.action: Petition to finally shut down Dogs4Us and eradicate all puppy farming.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is still rife in the country and as a result thousands of animals are inhumanely treated and forced to breed. Millions of families receive animals who are in poor health and have numerous defects. Sadly many of these animals come from organisations like Dogs4Us. Lets stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs4Us has been exposed by numerous reputable news outlets yet the suffering still continuous. Together we can stop this abuse and shut down places like dogs4us as well as banning the act of puppy farming once and for all.

attributes.action: Make an allowance for children with social challenges to have term time holiday
attributes.background: Children on the autistic spectrum for instance can find being around others difficult, it can be overwhelming and make them very uncomfortable. They often need more space and time to adjust and process and they ought to have the opportunity for a relaxing holiday, like any one else.
attributes.additional_details: Term time holidays would allow for a quieter environment, more physical and mental space, slower / calmer interactions with people, less stress caused by social situations, less queuing, less waiting, a break from peers, the result being a calmer and more relaxed child and therefore family.

attributes.action: Refuse entry to the refugees currently held up in Calais camps when they close
attributes.background:
There are currently over 5000 refugees camping at Calais. Natacha Bouchart plans to demolish these camps and send these people to the UK. She says this will happen "very soon". 
Our country is not capable of such numbers nor are we a soft touch.
This is not our problem.
attributes.additional_details:
Read the story here about the impending demolishing of the camps. 
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/calais-mayor-says-brexit-means-8408236?utm_content=buffercbf60&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_campaign=buffer

attributes.action: Support the provision of new bomb detection equipment to Baghdad checkpoints.
attributes.background: On the 2nd of July, 165 innocent Iraqis were killed in the Karrada district of Baghdad in a massive explosion near a shopping mall by car bomb- a truck to be precise.  Another car bomb explosion took the lives of around 100 innocent shoppers at a market in Baghdad a month before. The list is long.
attributes.additional_details: There are many Checkpoints in Baghdad. Police are still using fake bomb detectors bought via a bogus British businessman who was jailed in the UK over the deal 3 years ago. Iraqi Prime minister called for an end to their use. It is frustrating to see that so many innocent lives could be saved using modern security technologies, which the UK is a world leader in. I call on the British government to openly support the Iraqi authority in replacing bomb detection equipment at checkpoints.

attributes.action: Treat male and female victims of domestic and sexual violence equally.
attributes.background: The UK government sees domestic and sexual abuse as a gender issue. £50 million + is spent funding services for female victims. Nothing is spent on male victims.1/3 of all victims are male. 1 in 6 men experience abuse. The government needs a minister for men and boys, there is a minister for women.
attributes.additional_details: Research suggests 1 in 6 men experience some form of abuse. 30 men each year are killed. No government funding is provided to any service for male victims of domestic abuse, some money is given to the men's advice line. There are approx 10 000 refuge beds specifically for women, there are around 20 for men. 2 out of every 5 victims are male 40% men need 40% of the budget allocated to services to fund refuge beds, outreach support etc. This is not a gender issue this is about victims not gender.

attributes.action: Create a system in which breached child contact orders can be enforced quickly
attributes.background: Parents are being ripped away from their children for months after a separation while they await a court hearing. They spend thousands to get a court order which, if breached, has to be brought to court to be enforced. The wronged parent incurs all costs and is again seperated from his/her children.
attributes.additional_details: The parent breaching the court order is breaking the law yet it is the other parent, and the children, who suffer. It can take 4 months to get a date for the original order to be enforced which is unacceptable. The parent breaching the court order should be forced to pay all costs and this process should take a maximum of, for example, 30 days. This will minimise the emotional impact on the children and parents whilst reducing the occurance of breached orders.

attributes.action: The independent election of the director general of the BBC.
attributes.background: There are numerous cases recently where the journalistic integrity and neutrality of the British Broadcasting Corporation has come into question.  The neutrality of the BBC is essential in order for the British people to make informed decisions regarding Politics in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Lift EU/US sanctions on Russia to increase trade now the UK is leaving the EU
attributes.background: As the UK has chosen to exit the EU, we will be no longer bound by US-influenced, EU sanctions on Russia. We should lift sanctions on Russia as an independent country to regain the millions of pounds of trade we have lost with Russia. We don't need to participate in EU/US sanctions against Russia.
attributes.additional_details: The EU and the US introduced sanctions on Russia over the democratic decision of the people of Crimea to reunify with Russia and Russia's alleged backing of separatists in Eastern Ukraine. The UK had to participate in this as an EU member. Now the UK is leaving the EU, we need not be dictated to by it. Lost trade with Russia costs the UK many millions of pounds. This is trade that we are now at liberty to get back. Russia is a market of 140m consumers British business needs.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Jo Cox in Parliament Square.
attributes.background: Jo Cox was brutally murdered at her constituency surgery.  Jo was a well loved and respected campaigner and MP who always stood up for others.  Parliament Square has 11 statues, none of women.

attributes.action: Replace subsidies for green energy (FITs)  with a loan guarantee scheme.
attributes.background:
Producing green energy has become more viable as cost of deployment has reduced drastically (IRENA).
Loan guarantees would enable more schemes to be built than subsidies (FITs) and could potentially negate the need for the nuclear plant at Hinkley whilst contributing towards environmental targets.
attributes.additional_details:
Government subsidies (FITs) for medium/large scale green energy schemes have been reduced.  
New schemes face difficulty in raising finance because lenders are unable to analyse the risk/reward the sector represents.  
Finance contributes to the 25 Giga Watts held up and awaiting deployment (DECC April 2016).  
A rolling scheme of up to £5 billion could replace the need for Hinkley Point C to be built providing 3200+ MW of green energy.
Example:  www.greensaturn.com/content/pages/renewablesnothinkley

attributes.action: Only one councillor should represent a ward in the local councils.
attributes.background: Derbyshire PCC Mr Hardayal Dhindsa is a local councillor as well. PCC role is quite demanding and a full time position, still Mr Dhindsa decided to continue as a Councillor. This shows that three councillors aren't needed to represent a ward specially when in Sandwell 71 out of 72 are from Labour.
attributes.additional_details: In Derby there are total of 17 wards and every ward has 3 councillors. Interestingly if all three are from the same party then it becomes quite pointless to have them. There is no job description and position doesn't have any accountability. One tory councillor kept on getting paid while he lived abroad. Also councils like Sandwell only have Labour councillors and that has been the case for ages. Local democracy is failing and need urgent reforms.

attributes.action: Legalise the right to own and open/conceal carry a taser and/or pepper spray.
attributes.background: Through the years it has become more off a reality that the public is threatened. Police are no longer able to adequitley protect us. Tasers and pepper spray are non leathal and we should be allowed to carry them. As a human i have the right to protect myself and should be allowed to use these.
attributes.additional_details:
Rape is on the rise across the UK. Woman in particular are quite often not able to defend themselves and should be allowed to carry such defensive weapons as a taser or pepper spray. 

If a potential rapist, mugger etc saw a taser holstered to a persons hip they would be less inclined to carry out the crime. Same as if employees in shops had acess to one less robberies would take place. Common sense? Yes i think so.

attributes.action: Link all public sector salaries to MPs' salaries (Backdated to April 2014)
attributes.background: Since April 2014, MPs' salaries have increased by 10.3%, whereas most  working in the public sector have seen salary stagnation. The goal of this petition is to link the increase of public sector salaries with MPs' salaries both backdated to April 2014 and in the future.

attributes.action: Exempt self employed subbies from Class 4 national insurance contributions.
attributes.background: From 2015, self employed people have to pay 9% national insurance on all profits over £8000 which brings your total yearly tax up to near a whopping 29% per year. Previously self employed people only had to pay a rate of £2.80 per week class 2 national insurance as they were not directly employed.

attributes.action: Make self defence a legitimate reason to own a firearms licence
attributes.background: Law abiding British citzens have a right to own firearms to protect themselves and their family from harm, by using force against any aggressors. This will discourage criminals who may own firearms illegally, from any further criminal activity, due to the risk of resistance by law abiding citzens.

attributes.action: Properly fund the NHS and scrap the proposed STP programme.
attributes.background: The UK spends less on health as a share of its GDP than most other G7 countries. Our NHS is under pressure as never before and is in danger of failure. The NHS is effectively only getting an increase of 0.95% per year. The STP programme will close A&E's and essential services across the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Spending on health compared to other countries:
http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-compared

Effective increase of 0.95% per year for the NHS:
http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/nhs-budget

Draft sustainability and transformation plans (STPs) which propose ward closures, cuts in bed numbers and changes to A&E and GP care in 44 areas:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37186455

attributes.action: Mandatory life sentence for anyone caught committing a Terror attack
attributes.background: In the light of recent terror attacks across the EU and the lenient prison sentences these individuals receive. We would like the law changed so that anyone committing or planning a terror attack, joining terror group and their accomplices receive a mandatory life sentence of no less than 25 years
attributes.additional_details: Recent terror attack in France saw a Priest beheaded by an individual recently released from Prison. He served a light sentence for trying to join an ISIS group in Syria. These people would of been safe if these individual had been jailed for life.

attributes.action: Stop road resurfacing with tar and chippings
attributes.background: Stop resurfacing roads using tar and chippings, it is extrememly dangerous for cyclists and motorbike riders and can also damage car paint work (even when the 20mph limit is adhered too) not to mention the herrendous mess which it can cause when the stones are carried hundreds of meteres away.

attributes.action: Stop organisations from charging more for not making payment by Direct Debit.
attributes.background: Direct debit gives a third party open access to your wallet and bank account at any time and at will. Those who pay by other LEGAL methods are penalized with higher fees. In effect its a stealth tax charged by companies who want easy access to YOUR money. Its not right, Its not moral and its unjust.
attributes.additional_details:
If funds are not available or a payments going into account are not there on time due to bank errors or delays in employee payments or benefit payments it can cause LIFE THREATENING problems for those on a low budget as bank fees are taken from allowances put aside for food or essentials. This puts incredible pressure those on a tight budget who are hit the most with unrealistic fees for returned direct debits forcing them into further debt.

This is immoral for modern day British Companies.

attributes.action: Petition the new New Prime mimister
attributes.background:
The British People demand that When the next Conservative Leader is elected They Sign a Statement of intent Has to when They will invoke Article 50 Before the end of 2016
To reasure the Business World stability And the British Nation
attributes.additional_details:
It is now important that the Goverment 
Stand and deliver on the democratic vote of this nation and come clean on there intentions No more dirty tricks lies and misleading information When will article 50 or Preferably article 72 be signed

attributes.action: The UK should not leave the EU until all devolved assemblies of the UK agree.
attributes.background: The non-binding EU referendum has shown a simple majority for the 'leave the EU' option. However the results represent the majority view of the English and Welsh but not of voters in Scotland, Northern Ireland and London. It would undemocractic to force this result on the UK as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: The vote has not produced a clear mandate from the whole of the United Kingdom. There is now a very real risk of the UK disintegrating if this vote is simply seen as a mandate to remove the UK from the EU. The Government may accept the the result as advisory, but should now discuss will all devolved assemblies and with the EU as to a means of obtaining a compromise on the views expressed by this divided nation.

attributes.action: Raise awareness for Seat Back Failure, putting your children's lives at risk.
attributes.background: During a rear impact crash our front seats fully reclined with force, we have been informed this is standard from 'cheap' cars- ours was a 2014 model.  This happens with all makes and models potentially putting passenger's lives at risk. This Is unacceptable and higher standards are needed.
attributes.additional_details: Our mechanic informed us it is expected from cheaper cars as they use low quality seats, more expensive makes use higher quality. We believe there should be a standard of seats used, we are told to put our children in the back of our cars- unbeknownst to us potentially putting their lives at risk should they be in a crash! The front seats fly back at force, along with the person in them and the passengers in the back are flung forward- it's so very very dangerous.

attributes.action: Reduce Animal testing and put harsher rules in place when testing on animals
attributes.background: I have never been a fan of animal testing but I believe without it we wouldn't have the scientific knowledge that we have now. I would like the government to put harsher rules on animal testing and also for companies to have to display that they test on animals on the labels of their products.
attributes.additional_details:
A little more information... Some of the rules that I believe should be put in place:

-Any animal that is tested on should immediately be released and   
given the best quality of life possible or be put down. They should also be given freedom while being tested on.
-Any company that tests on animals should be forced to make a 
minimum donation to charities that support any animal wellbeing. 
-Any company or brand that tests on animals must display this on their packaging in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for people to smoke while in charge of a motor vehicle.
attributes.background: Using a mobile phone behind the wheel in the UK is banned because it's distracting and causes accidents, so why isn't smoking behind the wheel illegal too. It's dangerous for drivers as only one hand is likely to be present, but also distracting to roll, find and light a cigarette.
attributes.additional_details: Attention is key while driving and smoking distracts you fully from the road. It should not be allowed to promote safety in cars and also healthier living in the population.

attributes.action: Ban all chocolate made by child labour from entering the UK.
attributes.background: Thousands of children from different parts of the world are captured and sold into slavery to work on cocoa plantation farms for the use of large chocolate companies. Sign this petition to help these children gain back their rights and freedom.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently over 27 million slaves world-wide and 9 million of these are children sold into various trades. 

We want to help tackle this issue by first tackling the chocolate trade by banning chocolate that is cultivated by children from entering the UK. This ban would raise world-wide awareness on an issue, which is currently being ignored.
